member.name: N:CodeCarvings.Piczard
member.summary: The CodeCarvings.Piczard namespace contains the core classes, interfaces, and enumerations of the library.
member.remarks: Please see: How Piczard Works

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.IQuantizableFormatEncoderParams
member.summary: Defines methods that must be implemented by a FormatEncoderParams class that handles an image format that requires image quantization.
member.remarks: The quantization process is a technique that allows to reduce the number of colors required to represent a digital image. For further information about color quantization please see: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_quantization http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa479306.aspx

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.IQuantizableFormatEncoderParams.GetPerformImageQuantization(System.Drawing.Image)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the Image must be quantized before saving.
member.returns: true if the image must be quantized; otherwise false.
member.param: The Image that must be saved

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.IQuantizableFormatEncoderParams.GetQuantizationMaxColors
member.summary: Returns the maximum number of colors the quantized image can contain.
member.returns: The maximum number of colors (e.g. 256, 128, 64, 32, etc...).

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.CropConstraintImageSelectionStrategy
member.summary: Specifies the ways a CropConstraint filter can calculate an ImageSelection.
member.remarks: For more information please see: Automatic Image Crop (paragraph: "Image selection strategy").

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.CropConstraintImageSelectionStrategy.Slice
member.summary: Image is automatically resized - and - the crop rectangle is calculated so to stay fully inside the image.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.CropConstraintImageSelectionStrategy.WholeImage
member.summary: Image is automatically resized - and - the crop rectangle is calculated so that it can contain the entire resized image (if possible).

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.CropConstraintImageSelectionStrategy.DoNotResize
member.summary: Image is not resized (if possible).

member.summary: The CropConstraint object is an instance of the FixedCropConstraint class.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.CropConstraintMode.FixedAspectRatio
member.summary: The CropConstraint object is an instance of the FixedAspectRatioCropConstraint class.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.CropConstraintMode.Free
member.summary: The CropConstraint object is an instance of the FreeCropConstraint class.

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.FixedResizeConstraintImagePosition
member.summary: Specifies the ways an image can be positioned within the fixed size area of a FixedResizeConstraint filter.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.FixedResizeConstraintImagePosition.Fill
member.summary: The image is resized to fill in the Fixed Size (the native aspect ratio is preserved). If the Size aspect ratio (width:height) differs from the source image, then the image is clipped.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.FixedResizeConstraintImagePosition.Fit
member.summary: The image is resized to fit in the Fixed Size (the native aspect ratio is preserved). If the Size aspect ratio (width:height) differs from the source image, then the CanvasColor is used to fill the Size area.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.FixedResizeConstraintImagePosition.Stretch
member.summary: The image is resized to fill the FIxed Size. The native aspect ratio is not preserved.

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Defines the color to use as background and the behavior to follow when an image format supports transparency. This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: BackgroundColor is a general-purpose class that allows to configure a color to use as background in 2 distinct situations: When the output image format does not support transparency (e.g. JPEG). In this case Piczard always uses the color specified in the Value property of the BackgroundColor class. When the output image format supports transparency (e.g. PNG). In this case there are two possibilities: If the AutoUseTransparentColor property of the BackgroundColor class is set to true (default value), then Piczard use the Transparent color (in order to preserve the image transparency). If the AutoUseTransparentColor property of the BackgroundColor class is set to false, then Piczard uses the color specified in the Value property of the BackgroundColor class. The BackgroundColor class is used by the ImageProcessingJob class in order to manage the image background color settings. It is also used by other Piczard filters (e.g. the CanvasColor property of the ImageCrop class). For more information please see: Image Processing Job (Controlling the background color of images generated by Piczard). Please note that, when an image is processed but not saved (e.g. when the GetProcessedImage method is invoked), then the BackgroundColor class acts as if the output image format supports transparency.

member.summary: Represents the default graphics unit used by the Piczard library. This field is constant.
member.remarks: The value of this constant is GfxUnit.Pixel.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.CropMargins.Auto
member.summary: Gets a new instance of the CropMargins class that specifies automatic margins.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.CropMargins.Horizontal
member.summary: Ges or sets the value of the Horizontal margin.
member.remarks: The value of the margin is expressed in the same Unit of measure of the CropConstraint. The value can be: null - (automatic margin; max value is CoreSettings.Drawing.MaxImageSize.Width) 0 (disabled margin) Greater than 0 Please note that if you, for example set the Horizontal margin to 5 pixels, this mean that the total size of the horizontal margins is 10 pixels (5 pixels for the left margin a 5 pixels for the right margin).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.CropMargins.Vertical
member.summary: Ges or sets the value of the Vertical margin.
member.remarks: The value of the margin is expressed in the same Unit of measure of the CropConstraint. The value can be: null - (automatic margin; max value is CoreSettings.Drawing.MaxImageSize.Height) 0 (disabled margin) Greater than 0 Please note that if you, for example set the Vertical margin to 5 pixels, this mean that the total size of the vertical margins is 10 pixels (5 pixels for the top margin a 5 pixels for the bottom margin).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.CropMargins.Zero
member.summary: Gets a new instance of the CropMargins class that specifies disabled margins (0).

member.remarks: If the value of the Unit parameter is null, then the default unit is used. Example: Assuming to work with a TextWatermark filter. If TextWatermark.Font.Unit is null, then the default unit is specified by the TextWatermark.Unit property.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.FormatEncoderParams.ImageFormatId

member.remarks: The Guids that uniquely identify the default image formats are available through the Guid property of the System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat class. In particular: Bmp: System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat.Bmp.Guid = b96b3cab-0728-11d3-9d7b-0000f81ef32e Gif: System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat.Gif.Guid = b96b3cb0-0728-11d3-9d7b-0000f81ef32e Jpeg: System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat.Jpeg.Guid = b96b3cae-0728-11d3-9d7b-0000f81ef32e Png: System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat.Png.Guid = b96b3caf-0728-11d3-9d7b-0000f81ef32e Tiff: System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat.Tiff.Guid = b96b3cb1-0728-11d3-9d7b-0000f81ef32e

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.GenericFormatEncoderParams
member.summary: Represents any file format that does not have a specific FormatEncoderParams class (such as JpegFormatEncoderParams or GifFormatEncoderParams). This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: The GenericFormatEncoderParams class cannot be directly instantiated. Piczard automatically initializes a new instance of the GenericFormatEncoderParams class if no specific FormatEncoderParams class is available for a certain image format. For more information about FormatEncoderParams please see: How Piczard Works (paragraph: "Customize the image format of output images").

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.GfxUnitConverter.ConvertGfxUnitToGraphicsUnit(CodeCarvings.Piczard.GfxUnit)
member.summary: Converts a unit of measure used by Piczard (GfxUnit) into the corresponding unit of measure used by the System.Drawing objects (GraphicsUnit).
member.returns: The corresponding unit of measure.
member.remarks: If it's not possible to convert the unit of measure (for example "Centimeter" is available only in the GfxUnit enumeration but not in GraphicsUnit) then an Exception is thrown. In order to avoid that any Exception is thrown may be useful to invoke the GetCanConvertGfxUnitToGraphicsUnit method before invoking the ConvertGfxUnitToGraphicsUnit method.
member.param: The unit of measure to convert.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.GfxUnitConverter.ConvertGraphicsUnitToGfxUnit(System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit)
member.summary: Converts a unit of measure used by the System.Drawing objects (GraphicsUnit) into the corresponding unit of measure used by Piczard (GfxUnit).
member.returns: The corresponding unit of measure.
member.remarks: If it's not possible to convert the unit of measure (for example "Display" is available only in the GraphicsUnit enumeration but not in GfxUnit) then an Exception is thrown. In order to avoid that any Exception is thrown may be useful to invoke the GetCanConvertGraphicsUnitToGfxUnit method before invoking the ConvertGraphicsUnitToGfxUnit method.
member.param: The unit of measure to convert.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.GfxUnitConverter.GetCanConvertGfxUnitToGraphicsUnit(CodeCarvings.Piczard.GfxUnit)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether it is possible to convert a unit of measure used by Piczard (GfxUnit) into the corresponding unit of measure used by the System.Drawing objects (GraphicsUnit).
member.returns: true if GfxUnit can be converted to GraphicsUnit; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Not every unit of measure can be converted. For example "Centimeter" is available only in the GfxUnit enumeration but not in GraphicsUnit.
member.param: The unit of measure to convert.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.GfxUnitConverter.GetCanConvertGraphicsUnitToGfxUnit(System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether it is possible to convert a unit of measure used by the System.Drawing objects (GraphicsUnit) into the corresponding unit of measure used by Piczard (GfxUnit).
member.remarks: Not every unit of measure can be converted. For example "Display" is available only in the GraphicsUnit enumeration but not in GfxUnit.
member.returns: true if GraphicsUnit can be converted to GfxUnit; otherwise, false.
member.param: The unit of measure to convert.

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.ImageProcessingFilter
member.summary: Represents the abstract class from which every Piczard filter must inherit.
member.remarks: Please see: How Piczard Works. For information about how to implement a custom image processing filter please see: How To Develop A Custom Image Processing Filter.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.ImageProcessingFilter.Apply(CodeCarvings.Piczard.Processing.ImageProcessingActionExecuteArgs)
member.summary: Applies the current ImageProcessingFilter.
member.remarks: This method must be implemented in every ImageProcessingFilter class. It is automatically called by Piczard for example when the GetProcessedImage method is invoked. The Apply method takes as input (source Image) the property ImageProcessingActionExecuteArgs.Image. After the image has been processed, the Apply method method must store the output Image in the property ImageProcessingActionExecuteArgs.Image. In this way the next ImageProcessingFilter in the chain (ImageProcessingJob.Filters) will use it as input. When a new value is set for the property ImageProcessingActionExecuteArgs.Image, the previous one is automatically disposed. Please see: How To Develop A Custom Image Processing Filter The Example A.401 - "Custom filters" / MyCustomFilter1.
member.param: An instance of the ImageProcessingActionExecuteArgs class that encapsulates data concerning the image processing workflow.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.ImageProcessingFilter.GetImageProcessingJob
member.summary: Gets an instance of the ImageProcessingJob class that can be used to process the image; the current filter is added to the Filters collection of the ImageProcessingJob object.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.ImageProcessingFilter.GetImageProcessingJob(System.Single)
member.summary: Gets an instance of the ImageProcessingJob class that can be used to process the image; the current filter is added to the Filters collection of the ImageProcessingJob object and the specified OutputResolution (DPI) is used.
member.returns: An instance of the ImageProcessingJob class that can apply the current ImageProcessingFilter.
member.param: The resolution (DPI) of the images that are produced by the ImageProcessingJob object.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.ImageProcessingFilter.GetImageProcessingJob
member.summary: Gets an instance of the ImageProcessingJob class that can be used to process the image; the current filter is added to the Filters collection of the ImageProcessingJob object and the default OutputResolution (96 DPI) is used.
member.returns: An instance of the ImageProcessingJob class that can apply the current ImageProcessingFilter.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.ImageProcessingFilter.GetProcessedImage
member.summary: Applies the current ImageProcessingFilter to the specified image and returns the result as a Bitmap object.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.ImageProcessingFilter.GetProcessedImage(System.Object,System.Single,CodeCarvings.Piczard.FormatEncoderParams)
member.summary: Applies the current ImageProcessingFilter to the specified image and returns the result as a Bitmap object; the specified output resolution (DPI) is used. BackgroundColor and quantization are applied according to the specified FormatEncoderParams.
member.returns: The image processed by the current ImageProcessingFilter.
member.param: The source image to process. Can be: a string (file path), a Stream, an array of bytes containing the image data, an Image object or a LoadedImage object.
The output resolution (DPI) used to process the image.
A FormatEncoderParams object used to guess the right BackgroundColor and quantization mode to apply to the output image.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.ImageProcessingFilter.GetProcessedImage(System.Object,System.Single)
member.summary: Applies the current ImageProcessingFilter to the specified image and returns the result as a Bitmap object; the specified output resolution (DPI) is used.
member.returns: The image processed by the current ImageProcessingFilter.
member.param: The source image to process. Can be: a string (file path), a Stream, an array of bytes containing the image data, an Image object or a LoadedImage object.
The output resolution (DPI) used to process the image.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.ImageProcessingFilter.GetProcessedImage(System.Object,CodeCarvings.Piczard.FormatEncoderParams)
member.summary: Applies the current ImageProcessingFilter to the specified image and returns the result as a Bitmap object; the default resolution (96 DPI) is used. BackgroundColor and quantization are applied according to the specified FormatEncoderParams.
member.returns: The image processed by the current ImageProcessingFilter.
member.param: The source image to process. Can be: a string (file path), a Stream, an array of bytes containing the image data, an Image object or a LoadedImage object.
A FormatEncoderParams object used to guess the right BackgroundColor and quantization mode to apply to the output image.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.ImageProcessingFilter.GetProcessedImage(System.Object)
member.summary: Applies the current ImageProcessingFilter to the specified image and returns the result as a Bitmap object; the default resolution (96 DPI) is used.

member.param: The source image to process. Can be: a string (file path), a Stream, an array of bytes containing the image data, an Image object or a LoadedImage object.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.ImageProcessingFilter.LoadImageProcessingActions(CodeCarvings.Piczard.Processing.ImageProcessingActionLoadArgs)
member.summary: Initializes and loads one more ImageProcessingAction objects that will be used during the image processing workflow.
member.remarks: This method is automatically called by Piczard for example when the GetProcessedImage method is invoked (before ImageProcessingFilter.Apply). By default, the LoadImageProcessingActions Initializes a new instance of the ImageProcessingFilterAction class associated with the current ImageProcessingFilter. Subsequently, the ImageProcessingFilterAction object is added to the Actions property of the ImageProcessingActionLoadArgs parameter. After the method LoadImageProcessingActions is invoked on every ImageProcessingFilter instance of the ImageProcessingJob.Filters collection, the image is processed: The ImageProcessingFilter.Apply method is invoked for every ImageProcessingFilterAction contained in the ImageProcessingActionLoadArgs.Actions property. Please see: How To Develop A Custom Image Processing Filter The Example A.401 - "Custom filters" / MyAggretatedFilters.
member.param: An instance of the ImageProcessingActionLoadArgs class that encapsulates data concerning the "LoadActions" phase of the image processing workflow.

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.LoadedImage
member.summary: Represents an Image object loaded by Piczard.
member.remarks: The class encapsulates both the Image and the source from which the Image is loaded (e.g. a Stream object). The class is useful because, as indicated in the MSDN documentation (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/93z9ee4x.aspx), "You must keep the stream open for the lifetime of the Image". When the Dispose method of a LoadedImage instance is invoked, then both the Image and its source are automatically disposed.

member.summary: Computes the absolute value of the Measure, converts it to the specified graphics unit and then round it to the nearest integer.

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Configuration.DrawingSettings
member.summary: Encapsulates the drawing settings of Piczard . This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: For more information about configuring Piczard please see: Core Settings Example Config File (Non-Web Project) Example Config File (Web Project)

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Configuration.DrawingSettings.DefaultImageProcessingFilterDrawMode
member.summary: Gets the default ImageProcessingFilterDrawMode used by ImageProcessingFilters that implement the IMultiDrawModeImageProcessingFilter interface.
member.remarks: Computer graphics is a CPU intensive operation. In order to process images quickly, sometimes is necessary to use pointers or other advanced techniques. Unfortunately not every environment allow to use these advanced techniques (for example, ASP.NET Medium Trust does not permit the use of pointers) This property allows to configure the default way that image processing filters (implmenting the IMultiDrawModeImageProcessingFilter interface) process images. For example, if your application runs in an ASP.NET Medium Trust environment and you receive errors, you can try to set DefaultImageProcessingFilterDrawMode to ImageProcessingFilterDrawMode.Slow in the configuration file. Please see also: IMultiDrawModeImageProcessingFilter.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Configuration.DrawingSettings.MaxImageSize
member.summary: Gets the maximum Size (expressed in pixels) of an Image.
member.remarks: Please note that this values is not the maximum Image Size supported by Windows GDI+ (the graphics library that Piczard rely on). If you want to change this setting, you should configure the new value according to the computer/server resources (e.g. free RAM memory).

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Configuration.ImageArchiverSettings
member.summary: Encapsulates the settings of Piczard that control the loading and saving of images. This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: For more information about configuring Piczard please see: Core Settings Example Config File (Non-Web Project) Example Config File (Web Project)

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Configuration.ImageArchiverSettings.DefaultImageFormatId

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Configuration.ImageArchiverSettings.DefaultJpegQuality
member.summary: Gets the default jpeg quality.
member.remarks: Valid values are between 1 (min quality / file size) and 100 (max quality / file size).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Configuration.PictureTrimmerSettings.AutoLoadPiczardClientLibrary
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether PictureTrimmer controls automatically load the client-side library (JavaScript).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Configuration.PictureTrimmerSettings.ContentImageJpegQuality
member.summary: Gets the Jpeg quality of the images generated for the PictureTrimmer GUI.
member.remarks: This property is used by the PictureTrimmerCore.GetContentImageFormatEncoderParams method in order to setup the JpegFormatEncoderParams objects used to save images generated for the PictureTrimmer GUI. For further information about the images generated for the PictureTrimmer GUI (content images) please see: PictureTrimmerCore.GetContentImageJob method PictureTrimmerCore.GetContentImageFormatEncoderParams method

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Configuration.PictureTrimmerSettings.ContentImageMaxSize
member.summary: Gets the maximum Size (expressed in pixels) of the images generated for the PictureTrimmer GUI.
member.remarks: This property is used by the PictureTrimmerCore.GetContentImageJob method in order to setup the ImageProcessingJob objects able to generate the images generated for the PictureTrimmer GUI. It is not advisable to use images that are too big to avoid large files that require long download times. For further information about the images generated for the PictureTrimmer GUI (content images) please see: PictureTrimmerCore.GetContentImageJob method PictureTrimmerCore.GetContentImageFormatEncoderParams method

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Configuration.PictureTrimmerSettings.UseTemporaryFiles

member.remarks: Currently only the file containing the Piczard javascript code is compressed. If http compression is already configured on server or application, then it is suggested to set enableCompression to false in the configuration file.

member.summary: Gets the URL of the HttpHandler that provides access to the Piczard web resources.
member.remarks: The value of the MainHttpHandlerUrl property must be configured according to the HttpHandler path set in the configuration file. For more information about registration of HttpHandlers please refer to: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bya7fh0a.aspx http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms689475.aspx

member.summary: Represents an ImageProcessingFilter that allows to manipulate image colors by applying one or more System.Drawing.Imaging.ColorMatrix objects to an image. It is also the base class from which each filter that works with color matrices must inherit.
member.remarks: For information about this filter please see: Adjust And Change Image Colors (paragraph: "Color matrix filter").

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Helpers.ImageHelper.SetGraphicsDefaultQuality(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Restore the default values for the PixelOffsetMode, SmoothingMode, InterpolationMode and CompositingQuality properties of the specified Graphics object.
member.remarks: The following values are used: Graphics.PixelOffsetMode = PixelOffsetMode.Default Graphics.SmoothingMode = SmoothingMode.None Graphics.InterpolationMode = InterpolationMode.Bilinear Graphics.CompositingQuality = CompositingQuality.Default
member.param: The Graphics object of which to set the quality settings.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Helpers.ImageHelper.SetGraphicsMaxQuality(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Sets the values of the PixelOffsetMode, SmoothingMode, InterpolationMode and CompositingQuality properties of the specified Graphics object to ensure that the best quality will be used for the next drawing operations.
member.remarks: The following values are used: Graphics.PixelOffsetMode = PixelOffsetMode.HighQuality Graphics.SmoothingMode = SmoothingMode.HighQuality Graphics.InterpolationMode = InterpolationMode.HighQualityBicubic Graphics.CompositingQuality = CompositingQuality.AssumeLinear
member.param: The Graphics object of which to set the quality settings.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Helpers.ImageHelper.SetImageResolution(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the resolution, in pixels per inch, of the Image.
member.remarks: Both the VerticalResolution and HorizontalResolution properties of the Image object are updated.
member.param: The image of which to set the resolution.
The new resolution (DPI).

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Plugins.IDynamicLocalizationPlugin
member.summary: Defines methods that must be implemented by a Plugin class that handles dynamic localization.
member.remarks: Please see: Localizing And Customizing Texts The example A.402 - "Localize & customize texts". Piczard Plugins Overview How To Develop A Custom Plugin

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Plugins.IDynamicLocalizationPlugin.GetString(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a localized string.
member.returns: A PluginOperationResult<string> that indicates if the Plugin has handled the request. In case of success (Handled=true) the Value property contains the localized string.
member.param: The key of the string to localize (e.g. "PPT_Popup_Button_Save").
The name of the culture in which the string has to be localized (e.g. "en" or "it-IT").

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Plugins.IImageArchiverPlugin
member.summary: Defines methods that must be implemented by a Plugin class that wants to manage the loading and/or saving of a particular image format.
member.remarks: Please see: Piczard Plugins Overview How To Develop A Custom Plugin

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Plugins.IImageArchiverPlugin.GetDescriptionFromImageFormatId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets a short description that describes a particular image format.
member.returns: A PluginOperationResult<string> that indicates if the Plugin has handled the request. In case of success (Handled=true) the Value property contains a short description (e.g. "(JPG) Joint Photographic Experts Group") that describes the image format.
member.param: The Guid that identifies the image format.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Plugins.IImageArchiverPlugin.GetFileExtensionFromImageFormatId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the default file extension associated with a particular image format.
member.returns: A PluginOperationResult<string> that indicates if the Plugin has handled the request. In case of success (Handled=true) the Value property contains the default file extension (e.g. ".jpg") associated with the image format.
member.param: The Guid that identifies the image format.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Plugins.IImageArchiverPlugin.GetFormatEncoderParams(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets a FormatEncoderParams object able to handle a particular image format.
member.returns: A PluginOperationResult<FormatEncoderParams> that indicates if the Plugin has handled the request. In case of success (Handled=true) the Value property contains the FormatEncoderParams associated with the image format.
member.param: The Guid that identifies the image format.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Plugins.IImageArchiverPlugin.GetHandledFileExtensions
member.summary: Gets an array containing the file extensions of all the image formats handled by the Plugin.

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Plugins.Plugin
member.summary: Represents the base class for Piczard plugins; all plugins must be objects that implement this class.
member.remarks: Only Piczard can initialize a new instance of a Plugin class. Every Plugin method that can be invoked by Piczard expects 2 types of results: Generic PluginOperationResult<T> - For methods that produce a value. PluginOperationResult - For methods that do not produce any value (void). Moreover a Plugin method can handle - or not handle - a particular method invocation. Example: if a Piczard Plugin implements the IDynamicLocalizationPlugin interface, then it contains the following method: PluginOperationResult<string> GetString(string key, string culture, string tag) Supposing that such Plugin handles only the "fr" language, then there are 2 kind of results: PluginOperationResult<T> with the Handled property set to true and the Value property valorized - if the culture parameter passed to the method by Piczard is equal to "fr". PluginOperationResult<T> with the Handled property set to false - if the culture parameter passed to the method by Piczard is not equal to "fr". For more informatio about Piczard Plugins please see: Piczard Plugins Overview How To Register A Plugin How To Develop A Custom Plugin

member.param: The result that has to be returned by the Plugin method

member.name: N:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Processing
member.summary: The CodeCarvings.Piczard.Plugins.Core namespace provides classes that support the Image Processing infrastructure of Piczard.
member.remarks: Please see also: How To Develop A Custom Image Processing Filter

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Processing.IMultiDrawModeImageProcessingFilter
member.summary: Interface that must be implemented by ImageProcessingFilters that support different draw modes.
member.remarks: Computer graphics is a CPU intensive operation. In order to process images quickly, sometimes is necessary to use pointers or other advanced techniques. Unfortunately not every environment allow to use these advanced techniques. For example, ASP.NET Medium Trust does not permit the use of pointers. By implementing this interface, a complex ImageProcessingFilter can be optimized to run on different kind of environments. In case the environment does not allow to use certain advanced drawing techniques (such as pointers), the filter can use alternative drawing methods (probably much slow).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Processing.IMultiDrawModeImageProcessingFilter.DrawMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the draw mode that ImageProcessingFilter must use.

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Processing.ImageProcessingFilterDrawMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode of drawing for an ImageProcessingFilter that supports multiple drawing modes.
member.remarks: Please see also IMultiDrawModeImageProcessingFilter. Requires Piczard 1.1.x or higher.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Processing.ImageProcessingFilterDrawMode.Auto
member.summary: The ImageProcessingFilter automatically detects the optimal draw mode (e.g. "Slow" if a non-full-trust environment prevents from using the "Fast" mode).

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Processing.ImageProcessingFilterDrawMode.Slow
member.summary: Force the ImageProcessingFilter to use the slowest drawing mode to optimize compatibility with non full-trust environments.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Processing.ImageProcessingFilterDrawMode.Fast
member.summary: Force the ImageProcessingFilter to use the fastest drawing mode (this could be not compatible with non-full-trust environments).

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Processing.ImageProcessingTarget
member.summary: Specifies the type of result of an image processing workflow.

member.remarks: This method clears the entire drawing surface and fills it with the background color. Please see: Image Processing Job (Controlling the background color of images generated by Piczard) How To Develop A Custom Image Processing Filter
member.param: The Graphics object to clear.

member.summary: Gets a dictionary of state information that allows to share information across multiple ImageProcessingAction objects.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Processing.ImageProcessingActionExecuteArgs.Image
member.summary: Gets the current image.
member.remarks: At the beginning of the image processing workflow the Image property contains the source image. Every ImageProcessingAction can alter this property, so that the next ImageProcessingAction in the Actions list will use it as input. When a new value is set for the property Image, the previous one is automatically disposed.

member.name: N:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web
member.summary: The CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web namespaces contains classes, interfaces, and enumerations for the Web environment.
member.remarks: Please see also: How PictureTrimmer Works InlinePictureTrimmer - Overview PopupPictureTrimmer - Overview

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.FlashWMode
member.summary: Indicates the possible values of the WMode attribute of the Adobe Flash Plugin.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.FlashWMode.Window
member.summary: The Adobe Flash movie plays in its own rectangle ("window") on the web page.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.FlashWMode.Opaque
member.summary: The Adobe Flash movie hides everything on the page behind it (this may slow animation performance).

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.FlashWMode.Transparent
member.summary: The background of the HTML page shows through all transparent portions of the Adobe Flash movie (this may slow animation performance).

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.FlashWMode.Direct
member.summary: The SWF content is directly rendered to the screen, bypassing compositing in the screen buffer. Requires version 10 of Adobe Flash player or greater and Piczard v1.2.3.1 or greater. -This is the suggested value-

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.FlashWMode.GPU
member.summary: Use additional hardware acceleration. Requires version 10 of Adobe Flash player or greater and Piczard v1.2.3.1 or greater.

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerAutoPostBackOnPopupCloseMode
member.summary: Specifies when a PopupPictureTrimmer control has to perform an automatic postback.
member.remarks: Please see also PopupPictureTrimmer - Server-side events

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerAutoPostBackOnPopupCloseMode.Never
member.summary: Page PostBack is never triggered when the popup window is closed.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerAutoPostBackOnPopupCloseMode.OnlyOnSave
member.summary: Page PostBack is triggered only if the user clicks the "Save" button.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerAutoPostBackOnPopupCloseMode.OnlyOnCancel
member.summary: Page PostBack is triggered only if the user clicks the "Cancel" button.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerAutoPostBackOnPopupCloseMode.Always
member.summary: Page PostBack is always triggered when the popup window is closed.

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerAutoZoomMode
member.summary: Specifies how a PictureTrimmer control automatically calculates the ZoomFactor.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerAutoZoomMode.Disabled
member.summary: Image is never zoomed to fit the PictureTrimmer canvas.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerAutoZoomMode.Enabled
member.summary: Image is always zoomed to fit the PictureTrimmer canvas, independently by its size.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerAutoZoomMode.EnabledOnlyForSmallImages
member.summary: Image is zoomed to fit the PictureTrimmer canvas only if its size is smaller than the PictureTrimmer canvas size (image will be enlarged).

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerAutoZoomMode.EnabledOnlyForLargeImages
member.summary: Image is zoomed to fit the PictureTrimmer canvas only if its size is bigger than the PictureTrimmer canvas size (image will be shrinked).

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerAutoZoomMode.Standard
member.summary: The PictureTrimmer control automatically detects if the image has to be zoomed to fit the canvas. By default the EnabledOnlyForLargeImages mode is used. If both PictureTrimmer.EnableCropping and PictureTrimmer.ShowZoomPanel are false then the image is not zoomed.

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCropShadowMode
member.summary: Indicates how a PictureTrimmer GUI renders the cropping mask.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCropShadowMode.Standard
member.summary: The cropping mask darkens more the image area than the canvas area.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCropShadowMode.Flat
member.summary: The cropping mask darkens both the image area and the canvas area is the same way.

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerImageBackColorApplyMode
member.summary: Specifies if and when the ImageBackColor must be applied by a PictureTrimmerValue filter or a PictureTrimmer control.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerImageBackColorApplyMode.DoNotApply
member.summary: The ImageBackColor is not applied . Note: this option causes the format of the content image displayed by the PictureTrimmer GUI to be Png.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerImageBackColorApplyMode.ApplyBeforeImageAdjustments
member.summary: The ImageBackColor is applied before the ImageAdjustmentsFilter. Note: this option causes the format of the content image displayed by the PictureTrimmer GUI to be Jpeg.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerImageBackColorApplyMode.ApplyAfterImageAdjustments
member.summary: The ImageBackColor is applied after the ImageAdjustmentsFilter. Note: this option causes the format of the content image displayed by the PictureTrimmer GUI to be Png.

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerMode
member.summary: Specifies the type of a PictureTrimmer or of a PictureTrimmerCore object.
member.remarks: Please see: How PictureTrimmer Works InlinePictureTrimmer - Overview PopupPictureTrimmer - Overview

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerMode.Inline
member.summary: The PictureTrimmer object is an instance of the InlinePictureTrimmer class - or - the PictureTrimmerCore object is an instance of the InlinePictureTrimmerCore class.

member.name: F:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerMode.Popup
member.summary: The PictureTrimmer object is an instance of the PopupPictureTrimmer class - or - the PictureTrimmerCore object is an instance of the PopupPictureTrimmerCore class.

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.InlinePictureTrimmer
member.summary: Represents a PictureTrimmer control that is displayed inline in the web page. This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: For more information about the InlinePictureTrimmer control please see InlinePictureTrimmer - Overview.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.InlinePictureTrimmer.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the InlinePictureTrimmer class.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.InlinePictureTrimmer.RetainUIParams
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control has to retain the PictureTrimmerUIParams after every postback.
member.remarks: If RetainUIParams is false, then the PictureTrimmerUIParams are reset after every postback. For example the ZoomFactor and the scroll position are automatically recalculated.

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.InlinePictureTrimmerCore
member.summary: Encapsulates the main properties and methods of a InlinePictureTrimmer control. This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: The InlinePictureTrimmerCore class can be used to help client-side functions that allow to dynamically load and process images. For more information please see: Client-Side Load, Unload And Save Images. The example A.307 - "Client side load, unload and save images". For more information about the InlinePictureTrimmer control please see InlinePictureTrimmer - Overview.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.DeleteTemporaryFiles
member.summary: Deletes the temporary files associated with the currently loaded image.
member.remarks: This method can be used only if the PictureTrimmer control is configured to use temporary files (WebSettings.PictureTrimmer.UseTemporaryFiles: true).

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this PictureTrimmer control.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.GetImageProcessingJob
member.summary: Gets an instance of the ImageProcessingJob class that can be used to process an image.
member.returns: An instance of the ImageProcessingJob class that can apply the current PictureTrimmerValue filter.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.GetProcessedImage
member.summary: Applies the current PictureTrimmerValue filter to an image and returns the result as a Bitmap object.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.GetProcessedImage(CodeCarvings.Piczard.FormatEncoderParams)
member.summary: Applies the current PictureTrimmerValue filter to the currently loaded image and returns the result as a Bitmap object. BackgroundColor and quantization are applied according to the specified FormatEncoderParams.
member.returns: The processed image.
member.param: A FormatEncoderParams object used to guess the right BackgroundColor and quantization mode to apply to the output image.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.GetProcessedImage
member.summary: Applies the current PictureTrimmerValue filter to the currently loaded image and returns the result as a Bitmap object.
member.returns: The processed image.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.GetProcessedImage(System.Object,CodeCarvings.Piczard.FormatEncoderParams)
member.summary: Applies the current PictureTrimmerValue filter to the specified image and returns the result as a Bitmap object. BackgroundColor and quantization are applied according to the specified FormatEncoderParams.
member.returns: The processed image.
member.param: The source image to process. Can be: a string (file path), a Stream, an array of bytes containing the image data, an Image object or a LoadedImage object.
A FormatEncoderParams object used to guess the right BackgroundColor and quantization mode to apply to the output image.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.GetProcessedImage(System.Object)
member.summary: Applies the current PictureTrimmerValue filter to the specified image and returns the result as a Bitmap object.
member.returns: The processed image.
member.param: The source image to process. Can be: a string (file path), a Stream, an array of bytes containing the image data, an Image object or a LoadedImage object.

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.UnloadImage
member.summary: Unloads the current image.
member.remarks: This method unloads the currently loaded image and also deletes the temporary files (if necessary).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.AllowResize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether users can resize the source image through the GUI.
member.remarks: Users can resize the source image in 2 ways: By using the appropriate slider in the "Resize panel" (please see ShowResizePanel). Note: if AllowResize is false then the "Resize panel" is hidden. By dragging the crop handles*. Note: if AllowResize is false then the crop handles are hidden. * = Only if the current CropConstraint is a FixedCropConstraint. Please see: Interactively crop and/or resize an image (paragraph: "The image resize feature") The example A.403 - "Customize layout". Please see also the ShowResizePanel property.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.AutoFreezeOnFormSubmit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control has to automatically freeze the GUI when the form is submitted.
member.remarks: The PictureTrimmer "frozen" status is a feature that allows to hide the Flash User Interface (without losing any parameter). Please see the example A.311 "InlinePictureTrimmer - overview".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.AutoZoomMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the PictureTrimmer instance automatically calculates the ZoomFactor.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.CanvasColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the canvas.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.ContentImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the url used by the control to retrieve the image displayed within the GUI.
member.remarks: If the PictureTrimmer control is configured to use temporary files (WebSettings.PictureTrimmer.UseTemporaryFiles: true), then the ContentImageUrl property is automatically calculated. On the contrary, if temporary files are disabled, then it is mandatory to set this property when an image is loaded into the control. The resolution of the content image must be always 96 DPI (CommonData.DefaultResolution). The methods PictureTrimmerCore.GetContentImageJob and PictureTrimmerCore.GetContentImageFormatEncoderParams help to generate a valid content image. Please see the example A.305 - "Load & save images" / "Image stored in a DB (Without temporary files)".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.CropConstraint
member.summary: Gets the constraints that have to be satisfied by the cropped image.
member.remarks: The CropConstraint property can be set only when an image is loaded into the control. For example when one of the following methods is invoked: LoadImage LoadImageFromByteArray LoadImageFromFileSystem LoadImageFromStream Please see: Interactively crop and/or resize an image

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.CropShadowMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the PictureTrimmer GUI renders the cropping mask.
member.remarks: Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout". This property is ignored when the crop feature is disabled (EnableCropping: false).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.Culture
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture name used by the control to look up culture-specific resources at run time.
member.remarks: Please see: Localizing And Customizing Texts The example A.402 - "Localize & customize texts". The IStaticLocalizationPlugin and the IDynamicLocalizationPlugin interfaces.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.EnableAutoCenterView
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control has to automatically center the view after the user drags the crop area outside the visible area.
member.remarks: This property is ignored when the crop feature is disabled (EnableCropping: false).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.EnableCropping
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the crop feature is enabled .
member.remarks: The crop feature is enabled only when a CropConstraint is provided during the image load process. For example when one of the following methods is invoked: LoadImage LoadImageFromByteArray LoadImageFromFileSystem LoadImageFromStream

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.EnableSnapping
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the crop area automatically snaps to the edge or the center of the image when the user moves the rectangle near those positions.
member.remarks: The user can temporarily disable the snap feature by holding down the shift key while the crop rectangle is moved. Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout". Please see also the ShowCropAlignmentLines property. This property is ignored when the crop feature is disabled (EnableCropping: false).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.FlashWMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the Window Mode property of the Adobe Flash movie for transparency, layering, and positioning in the browser (it is strongly suggested to use the FlashWMode.Direct or the FlashWMode.Window setting).
member.remarks: Before version 1.2.3.1 of Piczard the default value was FlashWMode.Window. Using the FlashWMode.Opaque or FlashWMode.Transparent settings could slow down the animation and cause unexpected behaviors. It is strongly suggested to use the FlashWMode.Direct or the FlashWMode.Window setting.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.ImageBackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used to fill the image background.
member.remarks: Please see: Image Processing Job (Controlling the background color of images generated by Piczard) The example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.ImageBackColorApplyMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if and when the ImageBackColor must be applied to the image.
member.remarks: Please see also: Image Processing Job (Controlling the background color of images generated by Piczard)

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.ImageLoaded
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether an image is currently loaded into the PictureTrimmer control.
member.remarks: One of the following methods can be invoked to load an image into the control: LoadImage LoadImageFromByteArray LoadImageFromFileSystem LoadImageFromStream

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.Mode
member.summary: Gets the type of the PictureTrimmer control.
member.remarks: Please see: How PictureTrimmer Works InlinePictureTrimmer - Overview PopupPictureTrimmer - Overview

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.OnClientControlLoadFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client function to be called when the PictureTrimmer control is loaded in the browser.
member.remarks: Please see: InlinePictureTrimmer - Client-side events (paragraph: "The ControlLoad event handler") PopupPictureTrimmer - Client-side events (paragraph: "The ControlLoad event handler") The example A.313 - "InlinePictureTrimmer - Client side events". The example A.323 - "PopupPictureTrimmer - Client side events". The onControlLoad event handler is raised: When the control.load client function is invoked. When the control.unloadImage client function is invoked. The function receives 2 parameters: sender - A reference to the object that generated the event. args - An empty object.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.OnClientUserStateChangedFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client function to be called when the UserState of the PictureTrimmer control changes.
member.remarks: Please see: InlinePictureTrimmer - Client-side events (paragraph: "The UserStateChanged event handler") PopupPictureTrimmer - Client-side events (paragraph: "The UserStateChanged event handler") The example A.304 - "UserState / PictureTrimmer value". The example A.313 - "InlinePictureTrimmer - Client side events". The example A.323 - "PopupPictureTrimmer - Client side events". The example A.406 - "Real time crop preview" The function receives 2 parameters: sender - A reference to the object that generated the event. args - An empty object.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.OutputResolution
member.summary: Gets the resolution (DPI) of the images that are generated by the PictureTrimmer control.
member.remarks: The OutputResolution property can be set only when an image is loaded into the control. For example when one of the following methods is invoked: LoadImage LoadImageFromByteArray LoadImageFromFileSystem LoadImageFromStream

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.ShowCropAlignmentLines
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show lines that facilitate the alignment of the crop rectangle.
member.remarks: Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout". Please see also the EnableSnapping property. This property is ignored when the crop feature is disabled (EnableCropping: false).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.ShowDetailsPanel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the "Details panel" in the component GUI.
member.remarks: The "Details panel" contains information about the currently loaded image, such as: Original source image size (Width/Height). Resized image size (Width/Height). Cursor location (X/Y). In case the crop feature is enabled, then also the following information are displayed: Crop rectangle location (X/Y). Crop rectangle size (Width/Height). All values are expressed in the UIUnit. Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.ShowFlipPanel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the flip control in the "Rotate/Flip panel". The flip control allows the user to flip the image horizontally and/or vertically .
member.remarks: If both the ShowFlipPanel and the ShowRotatePanel properties are false, then the "Rotate/Flip panel" is hidden. Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.ShowImageAdjustmentsPanel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the "Adjustments panel" in the component GUI. The "Adjustments panel" allows the user to change Brightness, Contrast, Hue and/or Saturation of the Image.
member.remarks: Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.ShowResizePanel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the "Resize panel" in the component GUI. The "Resize panel" allows the user to change the ResizeFactor applied to the source Image.
member.remarks: If the AllowResize property is set to false, then the "Resize panel" is never displayed. Please see: Interactively crop and/or resize an image (paragraph: "The image resize feature") The example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.ShowRotatePanel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the rotate control in the "Rotate/Flip panel". The rotate control allows the user to rotate the image clockwise by 0, 90, 180 or 270 degrees.
member.remarks: If both the ShowRotatePanel and the ShowFlipPanel properties are false, then the "Rotate/Flip panel" is hidden. Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.ShowRulers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the rulers at the left and at the top of the working area.
member.remarks: The values displayed in the rulers are expressed in the UIUnit. Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.ShowZoomPanel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the "Zoom panel" in the component GUI. The "Zoom panel" allows the user to magnify an area of the image.
member.remarks: The "Zoom panel" allows to enlarge/shrink the displayed image without changing the ResizeFactor. Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.SourceImageFormatId
member.summary: Gets the format of the currently loaded Image.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.SourceImageResolution
member.summary: Gets the resolution, in pixels per inch, of the currently loaded Image.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.SourceImageSize
member.summary: Gets the Size, expressed in pixels, of the currently loaded Image.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional string that can be used to pass extra parameters during the dynamic localization process.
member.remarks: Please see: Localizing And Customizing Texts The example A.402 - "Localize & customize texts". The IDynamicLocalizationPlugin interface.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.TemporaryFileId
member.summary: Gets the id that uniquely identifies the temporary files associated with the currently loaded image.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.UIUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the graphic unit in which values are displayed in the GUI.
member.remarks: Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.UserState
member.summary: Gets or sets the current user state of the PictureTrimmer instance.
member.remarks: Please see: UserState & PictureTrimmer Value. The Value property. The example A.304 - "UserState & PictureTrimmer Value".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the current value of the PictureTrimmer instance.
member.remarks: Before returning the PictureTrimmerValue, this methods dynamically adjusts its data. For example: If the crop Rectangle is null, then it is automatically calculated. If the crop Rectangle does not satisfies the current CropConstraint, then it is automatically re-calculated. The ImageBackColorApplyMode property is always set to the value of the current ImageBackColorApplyMode. If you want to get the original (not adjusted) PictureTrimmerValue, then you have to use the UserState property. For more information please see: UserState & PictureTrimmer Value. Please see also the example A.304 - "UserState & PictureTrimmer Value".

member.name: E:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmer.ValueChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the Value of the PictureTrimmer control changes between posts to the server.
member.remarks: The ValueChanged event is raised when the Value of the PictureTrimmer control changes between posts to the server. This allows you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine whenever this event occurs. With the PopupPictureTrimmer control you can use the AutoPostBackOnPopupClose feature to automatically postback the page when the popup closes. In this way it's possible to raise the ValueChanged event as soon as the Value changes. Please see: InlinePictureTrimmer - Server-side events PopupPictureTrimmer - Server-side events (paragraph: "The ValueChanged event handler") The example A.312 - "InlinePictureTrimmer - Server Side Events" The example A.322 - "PopupPictureTrimmer - Server Side Events"

member.name: T:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore
member.summary: Encapsulates the main properties and methods of a PictureTrimmer control.
member.remarks: The PictureTrimmerCore class can be used to help client-side functions that allow to dynamically load and process images. For more information please see: Client-Side Load, Unload And Save Images. The example A.307 - "Client side load, unload and save images". For more information about the PictureTrimmer control please see: How PictureTrimmer Works InlinePictureTrimmer - Overview PopupPictureTrimmer - Overview

member.name: M:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.UnloadImage
member.summary: Unloads the current image.
member.remarks: This method unloads the currently loaded image and also deletes the temporary files (if necessary).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.AllowResize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether users can resize the source image through the GUI.
member.remarks: Users can resize the source image in 2 ways: By using the appropriate slider in the "Resize panel" (please see ShowResizePanel). Note: if AllowResize is false then the "Resize panel" is hidden. By dragging the crop handles*. Note: if AllowResize is false then the crop handles are hidden*. * = Only if the current CropConstraint is a FixedCropConstraint. Please see: Interactively crop and/or resize an image (paragraph: "The image resize feature") The example A.403 - "Customize layout". Please see also the ShowResizePanel property.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.AutoFreezeOnFormSubmit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control has to automatically freeze the GUI when the form is submitted.
member.remarks: The PictureTrimmer "frozen" status is a feature that allows to hide the Flash User Interface (without losing any parameter). Please see the example A.311 "InlinePictureTrimmer - overview".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.AutoZoomMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the control automatically calculates the ZoomFactor.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.CanvasColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the canvas.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.ContentImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the url used by the control to retrieve the image displayed within the GUI.
member.remarks: If the PictureTrimmer control is configured to use temporary files (WebSettings.PictureTrimmer.UseTemporaryFiles: true), then the ContentImageUrl property is automatically calculated. On the contrary, if temporary files are disabled, then it is mandatory to set this property when an image is loaded into the PictureTrimmerCore object. The resolution of the content image must be always 96 DPI (CommonData.DefaultResolution). The methods PictureTrimmerCore.GetContentImageJob and PictureTrimmerCore.GetContentImageFormatEncoderParams help to generate a valid content image. Please see the example A.305 - "Load & save images" / "Image stored in a DB (Without temporary files)".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.CropConstraint
member.summary: Gets the constraints that have to be satisfied by the cropped image.
member.remarks: The CropConstraint property can be set only when an image is loaded into the control. For example when one of the following methods is invoked: LoadImage LoadImageFromByteArray LoadImageFromFileSystem LoadImageFromStream Please see: Interactively crop and/or resize an image

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.CropShadowMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the control renders the cropping mask.
member.remarks: Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout". This property is ignored when the crop feature is disabled (EnableCropping: false).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.EnableAutoCenterView
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control has to automatically center the view after the user drags the crop area outside the visible area.
member.remarks: This property is ignored when the crop feature is disabled (EnableCropping: false).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.EnableCropping
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the crop feature is enabled .
member.remarks: The crop feature is enabled only when a CropConstraint is provided during the image load process. For example when one of the following methods is invoked: LoadImage LoadImageFromByteArray LoadImageFromFileSystem LoadImageFromStream

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.EnableSnapping
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the crop area automatically snaps to the edge or the center of the image when the user moves the rectangle near those positions.
member.remarks: The user can temporarily disable the snap feature by holding down the shift key while the crop rectangle is moved. Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout". Please see also the ShowCropAlignmentLines property. This property is ignored when the crop feature is disabled (EnableCropping: false).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.FlashWMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the Window Mode property of the Adobe Flash movie for transparency, layering, and positioning in the browser (it is strongly suggested to use the FlashWMode.Direct or the FlashWMode.Window setting).
member.remarks: Before version 1.2.3.1 of Piczard the default value was FlashWMode.Window. Using the FlashWMode.Opaque or FlashWMode.Transparent settings could slow down the animation and cause unexpected behaviors. It is strongly suggested to use the FlashWMode.Direct or the FlashWMode.Window setting.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.ImageBackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used to fill the image background.
member.remarks: Please see: Image Processing Job (Controlling the background color of images generated by Piczard) The example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.ImageBackColorApplyMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if and when the ImageBackColor must be applied to the image.
member.remarks: Please see also: Image Processing Job (Controlling the background color of images generated by Piczard)

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.ImageLoaded
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether an image is currently loaded into the control.
member.remarks: One of the following methods can be invoked to load an image into the control: LoadImage LoadImageFromByteArray LoadImageFromFileSystem LoadImageFromStream

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.Mode
member.summary: Gets the type of the PictureTrimmerCore object.
member.remarks: Please see: How PictureTrimmer Works InlinePictureTrimmer - Overview PopupPictureTrimmer - Overview

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.OnClientControlLoadFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client function to be called when the control is loaded in the browser.
member.remarks: Please see: InlinePictureTrimmer - Client-side events (paragraph: "The ControlLoad event handler") PopupPictureTrimmer - Client-side events (paragraph: "The ControlLoad event handler") The example A.313 - "InlinePictureTrimmer - Client side events". The example A.323 - "PopupPictureTrimmer - Client side events". The onControlLoad event handler is raised: When the control.load client function is invoked. When the control.unloadImage client function is invoked. The function receives 2 parameters: sender - A reference to the object that generated the event. args - An empty object.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.OnClientUserStateChangedFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client function to be called when the UserState of the control changes.
member.remarks: Please see: InlinePictureTrimmer - Client-side events (paragraph: "The UserStateChanged event handler") PopupPictureTrimmer - Client-side events (paragraph: "The UserStateChanged event handler") The example A.304 - "UserState / PictureTrimmer value". The example A.313 - "InlinePictureTrimmer - Client side events". The example A.323 - "PopupPictureTrimmer - Client side events". The example A.406 - "Real time crop preview" The function receives 2 parameters: sender - A reference to the object that generated the event. args - An empty object.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.OutputResolution
member.summary: Gets the resolution (DPI) of the images that are generated by the PictureTrimmerCore object.
member.remarks: The OutputResolution property can be set only when an image is loaded into the control. For example when one of the following methods is invoked: LoadImage LoadImageFromByteArray LoadImageFromFileSystem LoadImageFromStream

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.ShowCropAlignmentLines
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show lines that facilitate the alignment of the crop rectangle.
member.remarks: Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout". Please see also the EnableSnapping property. This property is ignored when the crop feature is disabled (EnableCropping: false).

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.ShowDetailsPanel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the "Details panel" in the component GUI.
member.remarks: The "Details panel" contains information about the currently loaded image, such as: Original source image size (Width/Height). Resized image size (Width/Height). Cursor location (X/Y). In case the crop feature is enabled, then also the following information are displayed: Crop rectangle location (X/Y). Crop rectangle size (Width/Height). All values are expressed in the UIUnit. Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.ShowFlipPanel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the flip control in the "Rotate/Flip panel". The flip control allows the user to flip the image horizontally and/or vertically .
member.remarks: If both the ShowFlipPanel and the ShowRotatePanel properties are false, then the "Rotate/Flip panel" is hidden. Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.ShowImageAdjustmentsPanel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the "Adjustments panel" in the component GUI. The "Adjustments panel" allows the user to change Brightness, Contrast, Hue and/or Saturation of the Image.
member.remarks: Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.ShowResizePanel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the "Resize panel" in the component GUI. The "Resize panel" allows the user to change the ResizeFactor applied to the source Image.
member.remarks: If the AllowResize property is set to false, then the "Resize panel" is never displayed. Please see: Interactively crop and/or resize an image (paragraph: "The image resize feature") The example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.ShowRotatePanel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the rotate control in the "Rotate/Flip panel". The rotate control allows the user to rotate the image clockwise by 0, 90, 180 or 270 degrees.
member.remarks: If both the ShowRotatePanel and the ShowFlipPanel properties are false, then the "Rotate/Flip panel" is hidden. Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.ShowRulers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the rulers at the left and at the top of the working area.
member.remarks: The values displayed in the rulers are expressed in the UIUnit. Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.ShowZoomPanel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the "Zoom panel" in the component GUI. The "Zoom panel" allows the user to magnify an area of the image.
member.remarks: The "Zoom panel" allows to enlarge/shrink the displayed image without changing the ResizeFactor. Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.SourceImageFormatId
member.summary: Gets the format of the currently loaded Image.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.SourceImageResolution
member.summary: Gets the resolution, in pixels per inch, of the currently loaded Image.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.SourceImageSize
member.summary: Gets the Size, expressed in pixels, of the currently loaded Image.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.TemporaryFileId
member.summary: Gets the id that uniquely identifies the temporary files associated with the currently loaded image.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.UIUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the graphic unit in which values are displayed in the GUI.
member.remarks: Please see the example A.403 - "Customize layout".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.UserState
member.summary: Gets or sets the current user state of the PictureTrimmerCore object.
member.remarks: Please see: The Value property. The example A.304 - "UserState & PictureTrimmer Value".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PictureTrimmerCore.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the current value of the PictureTrimmerCore object.
member.remarks: Before returning the PictureTrimmerValue, this methods dynamically adjusts its data. For example: If the crop Rectangle is null, then it is automatically calculated. If the crop Rectangle does not satisfies the current CropConstraint, then it is automatically re-calculated. The ImageBackColorApplyMode property is always set to the value of the current ImageBackColorApplyMode. If you want to get the original (not adjusted) PictureTrimmerValue, then you have to use the UserState property. Please see the example A.304 - "UserState & PictureTrimmer Value".

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PopupPictureTrimmer.OnClientAfterPopupCloseFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client function to be called after the popup window closes.
member.remarks: Please see: PopupPictureTrimmer - Client-side events (paragraph: "The ControlLoad event OnClientAfterPopupCloseFunction") The example A.323 - "PopupPictureTrimmer - Client side events". The function receives 2 parameters: sender - A reference to the object that generated the event. args - An object containing additional information about the event. In particular the args object provides the following properties: args.saveChanges Gets a value indicating whether the changes has been saved (readonly). args.performPostback Gets or sets a value indicating whether to perform a page postback.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PopupPictureTrimmer.OnClientAfterPopupOpenFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client function to be called after the popup window opens.
member.remarks: Please see: PopupPictureTrimmer - Client-side events (paragraph: "The ControlLoad event OnClientAfterPopupOpenFunction") The example A.323 - "PopupPictureTrimmer - Client side events". The function receives 2 parameters: sender - A reference to the object that generated the event. args - An object containing additional information about the event. In particular the args object provides the following properties: args.popupWindowThe Popup window HTML DOM element.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PopupPictureTrimmer.OnClientBeforePopupCloseFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client function to be called before the popup window closes.
member.remarks: Please see: PopupPictureTrimmer - Client-side events (paragraph: "The ControlLoad event OnClientBeforePopupCloseFunction") The example A.323 - "PopupPictureTrimmer - Client side events". The function receives 2 parameters: sender - A reference to the object that generated the event. args - An object containing additional information about the event. In particular the args object provides the following properties: args.saveChanges Gets or sets a value indicating whether to save the changes or not. args.previousUserStateGets the previous userState (before popup opens). args.newUserStateGets or sets the new userState. args.resetUIParams If you set this value to false, then the uiParameters will NOT be reset. In this case the next time the popup is opened the previous uiParams are applied. The default value is true. args.performPostbackGets or sets a value indicating whether to perform a page postback. args.goOn If you set this value to false then the popup will NOT close.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PopupPictureTrimmer.OnClientBeforePopupOpenFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client function to be called before the popup window opens.
member.remarks: Please see: PopupPictureTrimmer - Client-side events (paragraph: "The ControlLoad event OnClientBeforePopupOpenFunction") The example A.323 - "PopupPictureTrimmer - Client side events" The example A.405 - "Enrich the PopupPictureTrimmer window" The function receives 2 parameters: sender - A reference to the object that generated the event. args - An object containing additional information about the event. In particular the args object provides the following properties: args.windowWidth Gets or sets the width of the popup. args.windowHeight Gets or sets the height of the popup. args.reservedWindowHeightGets or sets the height of the popup window reserved for additional custom UI elements (pixels); the default value is 0 args.additionalTopElements Gets or sets an array of DOM elements to be added on the top of the popup window args.additionalBottomElements Gets or sets an array of DOM elements to be added on the bottom of the popup window args.lightBoxCssClass Gets or sets the CSS class of the popup. args.freezeOtherPictureTrimmerControls Gets or sets a value indicating whether to freeze other PictureTrimmer controls. The default value is true. args.goOn If you set this value to false then the popup will NOT open.

member.name: P:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PopupPictureTrimmer.SaveButtonText

member.name: E:CodeCarvings.Piczard.Web.PopupPictureTrimmer.PopupClose
member.summary: Occurs when the popup window closes.
member.remarks: The PopupClose event is raised after the page postback. You can use the AutoPostBackOnPopupClose feature to automatically postback the page when the popup closes. In this way it's possible to raise the PopupClose event as soon as the popup closes. Please see: PopupPictureTrimmer - Server-side events (paragraph: "The PopupClose event handler") The example A.322 - "PopupPictureTrimmer - Server Side Events"

member.summary: Encapsulates the main properties and methods of a PopupPictureTrimmer control. This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: The PopupPictureTrimmerCore class can be used to help client-side functions that allow to dynamically load and process images.
